item.title: Deb add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "We think that the point is to pass the test or to overcome the problem, but the truth is that things don't really get solved. They come together and they fall apart." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Deb add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "Fear is a natural reaction to moving closer to the truth" -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Deb add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "A man should hear a little music, read a little poetry, and see a fine picture every day of his life, in order that worldly cares may not obliterate the sense of the beautiful which God has implanted in the human soul." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Deb add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "You do not have to be good. You do not have to walk on your knees for a hundred miles through the desert, repenting. You only have to let the soft animal of your body love what it loves. Tell me about despair, yours, and I will tell you mine. Meanwhile the world goes on. Meanwhile the sun and the clear pebbles of the rain are moving across the landscapes, over the prairies and the deep trees, the mountains and the rivers. Meanwhile the wild geese, high in the clean blue air, are heading home again. Whoever you are, no matter how lonely, the world offers itself to your imagination, calls to you like the wild geese, harsh and exciting â€“ over and over announcing your place in the family of things." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Deb add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Deb add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Sometimes I need only to stand wherever I am to be blessed." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Deb add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "To pay attention, this is our endless and proper work." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Deb add a quote by Byron Katie
item.description: "Life is simple. Everything happens for you, not to you. Everything happens at exactly the right moment, neither too soon nor too late. You don't have to like it... it's just easier if you do." -- Byron Katie

item.title: Deb add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "To love. To be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and the vulgar disparity of life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all, to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Deb add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Deb add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Oh, the comfort, the inexpressible comfort of feeling safe with a person; having neither to weigh thoughts nor measure words, but to pour them all out, just as they are, chaff and grain together, knowing that a faithful hand will take and sift them, keep what is worth keeping, and then, with a breath of kindness, blow the rest away." -- George Eliot

item.title: Deb add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Thus it is our daughters leave us, Those we love, and those who love us! Just when they have learned to help us, When we are old and lean upon them, Comes a youth with flaunting feathers, With his flute of reeds, a stranger Wanders piping through the village, Beckons to the fairest maiden, And she follows where he leads her, Leaving all things for the stranger!" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Deb add a quote by Bernard Berenson
item.description: "Life has taught me that it is not for our faults that we are disliked and even hated, but for our qualities." -- Bernard Berenson

item.title: Deb add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "To be wise is to be eternally curious." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Deb add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Deb add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "There is no book so bad...that it does not have something good in it." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Deb add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Thou hast seen nothing yet." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Deb add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description:
"Demasiada cordura puede ser la peor de las locuras, ver la vida como es y no como deberÃ­a de ser.
Too much sanity may be madness. And maddest of all, to see life as it is and not as it should be." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Deb add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "What man can pretend to know the riddle of a woman's mind?" -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Deb add a quote by Roddy Doyle
item.description: "It was a sign of growing up, when the dark made no more difference to you than the day." -- Roddy Doyle

item.title: Deb add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Take me someplace where we can be silent together." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Deb add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Nothing is so essential as dignityâ€¦Time will reveal who has it and who has it not." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Deb add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "To show a longing for anything that one cannot have, for instance, is not a clever position." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Deb add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "One must bear what cannot be escaped," she told Alma, as she rubbed clean her face. "You will not die of your grief - no more than the rest of us ever have." -- Elizabeth Gilbert
